definition: to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
A rabbit doesn't eat the grass by its own burrow (idiom); One shouldn't do anything to harm one's neighbors.
pinyin: tu4 zi5 bu4 chi1 wo1 bian1 cao3

definition: variant of 敢做敢當|敢做敢当[gan3 zuo4 gan3 dang1]
to start rumours and create trouble
to recount history but omit one's ancestors (idiom); to forget one's roots
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
to involve others (in a crime)/guilt by association
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: bearer of ill luck/person with the evil eye/comet
to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
wine, sex, avarice and temper (idiom); four cardinal vices
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
